hook.text: Is the red you see the same red I see? There's no way to check. Welcome to the problem of qualia.

buildup.text: Qualia are the raw qualities of experience â€” the redness of red, the pain of pain, the warmth of warmth.

discovery.text: They're private and incommunicable. You can describe wavelengths of light, but not the experience of seeing red.

twist.text: Some philosophers deny qualia exist at all. Daniel Dennett calls them an illusion of introspection.

climax.text: If qualia are real, consciousness can't be reduced to information processing. That changes everything.

punchline.text: You can measure light. You can't measure seeing.

quiz.question: What are qualia?
options: The subjective qualities of conscious experience
